definition: Serbia/Serbian/abbr. for 塞爾維亞|塞尔维亚[Sai1 er3 wei2 ya4]
to stop up/to squeeze in/to stuff/cork/stopper
to stop up/to stuff/to cope with
sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)

sentences.english: Second, the GAP of the unaspirated bilabial plosives is longest.
sentences.chinese: 二是不送氣雙脣塞音的閉塞段時長最長。

sentences.english: In the aspirated situation, the regularity of the length of plosives'GAP is bad.
sentences.chinese: 在送氣情況下，塞音閉塞段時長的規律性較差。

sentences.english: In Southern Min languages, such as Teochew, prenasalized stops are also found.
sentences.chinese: 在閩南語裏，比如潮州方言，同樣有鼻冠塞音的存在。

sentences.english: In Chapter Four, Established and compared the acoustics pattern chart of modern Chinese dialects' plosives.
sentences.chinese: 第四章建立並比較了現代漢語方言塞音的聲學格局。

definition: (phonology) coda, the part of a syllable that follows its vocalic nucleus (e.g. "u" in kòu or "n" in běn)
entering tone/checked tone/one of the four tones of Middle Chinese
apical consonant (produced with the tip of the tongue, i.e. d or t)
alveolar/consonants z, c, s produced with the tip of the tongue on the alveolar ridge
velar nasal/consonant ng or ŋ produced in the nose with the back of the tongue against the soft palate
the final of a Chinese syllable (the component of a syllable remaining after removal of the initial consonant, if any, and the tone, e.g. the final of "niáng" is "iang")
consonant/the initial consonant (of a Chinese syllable)
